member.summary: Initializes the Cluster instance using a given factory Func.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement
member.summary: Allows a Couchbase Server's Bucket to be configured.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.UseEnhancedDurability
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use enhanced durability if the Couchbase server version supports it; if it's not supported the client will use Observe for Endure operations.
member.value: true to use enhanced durability; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.UseSsl
member.summary: Set to true to use Secure Socket Layers (SSL) to encrypt traffic between the client and Couchbase server.
member.remarks: Requires the SSL certificate to be stored in the local Certificate Authority to enable SSL.
This feature is only supported by Couchbase Cluster 3.0 and greater.
If the parent 's UseSSL is false, setting this to true will override that configuration and enable the Bucket to use SSL./>

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.Name
member.summary: The name of the Bucket.
member.remarks: The name can be set within the Couchbase Management Console.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.Password
member.summary: The password used to connect to the bucket.
member.remarks: The password can be set within the Couchbase Management Console.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.ConnectionPool
member.summary: Allows the default connection pool settings to be overridden.
member.remarks: The default settings are: MinSize=1, MaxSize=2, WaitTimout=2500ms, ShutdownTimeout=10000ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.ObserveInterval
member.summary: Gets or Sets the max time an observe operation will take before timing out.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.ObserveTimeout
member.summary: Gets or Sets the interval between each observe attempt.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.BucketElement.OperationLifespan
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation lifespan, maximum time in milliseconds allowed for an operation to run.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement
member.summary: Provides configuration support for the Bucket's object, which is pool of TCP connections.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the custom

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.Name
member.summary: The name for the connection pool.
member.remarks: This is used internally and does not need to be set or customized.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.MaxSize
member.summary: The maximum number of TCP connections that the client will allocate for a given Bucket.
member.remarks: The default is two TCP connections per bucket.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.MinSize
member.summary: The minimum number of TCP connections that the client will allocate for a given bucket.
member.remarks: The default is one TCP connection per bucket.
The connection pool will add TCP connections until is reached.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.WaitTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time a thread will wait for a once the MaxSize of the pool has been reached and no TCP connections are available.
member.remarks: The default is 2500ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.ShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Wait up to the to send or recieve data before closing the .
member.remarks: The default value is 10000ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.SendTimeout
member.summary: Cancels a pending operation if it does not complete in the time given and marks the connection as dead.
member.remarks: The default value is 15000ms

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.UseSsl
member.summary: Set to true to use Secure Socket Layers (SSL) to encrypt traffic between the client and Couchbase server.
member.remarks: Requires the SSL certificate to be stored in the local Certificate Authority to enable SSL.
This feature is only supported by Couchbase Cluster 3.0 and greater.
If the parent 's UseSSL is false, setting this to true will override that configuration and enable the Bucket to use SSL./>

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.BufferSize
member.summary: The size of each buffer to allocate per TCP connection for sending and recieving Memcached operations
member.remarks: The default is 16K
The total buffer size is BufferSize * PoolConfiguration.MaxSize

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: The amount time allotted for the client to establish a TCP connection with a server before failing
member.remarks: The default value is 10000ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.EnableTcpKeepAlives
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether enable TCP keep alives.
member.value: true to enable TCP keep alives; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default is true; TCP Keep Alives are enabled.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.TcpKeepAliveTime
member.summary: Specifies the timeout, in milliseconds, with no activity until the first keep-alive packet is sent.
member.value: The TCP keep alive time in milliseconds.
member.remarks: The default is 2hrs.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.TcpKeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Specifies the interval, in milliseconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received.
member.value: The TCP keep alive interval in milliseconds..
member.remarks: The default is 1 second.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.MaxCloseAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times the client will try to close a if it's in use and has been disposed.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.ConnectionPoolElement.CloseAttemptInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between close attempts on a if it's in use and has been disposed.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection
member.summary: Allows the Client Configuration to be set through an App.config or a Web.config.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.UseSsl
member.summary: Set to true to use Secure Socket Layers (SSL) to encrypt traffic between the client and Couchbase server.
member.remarks: Requires the SSL certificate to be stored in the local Certificate Authority to enable SSL.
This feature is only supported by Couchbase Cluster 3.0 and greater.
Set to true to require all buckets to use SSL.
Set to false and then set UseSSL at the individual Bucket level to use SSL on specific buckets.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.Servers
member.summary: Sets the Couchbase Server's list of bootstrap URI's. The client will use the list to connect to initially connect to the cluster.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.Buckets
member.summary: Allows specific configurations of Bucket's to be defined, overriding the parent's settings.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.SslPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the SSL port to use for Key/Value operations using the Binary Memcached protocol.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for SSL is 11207.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
Requires UseSSL to be true.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom SSL port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.ApiPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Views REST API to use a custom port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for the Views REST API is 8092.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Views REST API port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.MgmtPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Couchbase Management REST API to use a custom port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for the Views REST API is 8091.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Management REST API port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.DirectPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the direct port to use for Key/Value operations using the Binary Memcached protocol.
member.remarks: The default and suggested direct port is 11210.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom direct port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.HttpsMgmtPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Couchbase Management REST API to use a custom SSL port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for SSL is 18091.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
Requires UseSSL to be true.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Couchbase Management REST API SSL port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.HttpsApiPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Couchbase Views REST API to use a custom SSL port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for SSL is 18092.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
Requires UseSSL to be true.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Couchbase Views REST API SSL port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.ViewHardTimeout
member.summary: The maximum number of times the client will retry a View operation if it has failed for a retriable reason.

member.summary: Specifies the interval, in milliseconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received.
member.value: The TCP keep alive interval in milliseconds..

member.summary: Gets or sets the transporter for IO.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.NodeAvailableCheckInterval
member.summary: If the client detects that a node has gone offline it will check for connectivity at this interval.
member.remarks: The default is 1000ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.ConnectionPool
member.summary: Gets or sets the default connection pool settings.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.IOErrorThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the count of IO errors within a specific interval defined by the value of . If the threshold is reached within the interval for a particular node, all keys mapped to that node the SDK will fail with a in the field. The node will be flagged as "dead" and will try to reconnect, if connectivity is reached, the node will continue to process requests.
member.remarks: The purpose of this is to distinguish between a remote host being unreachable or temporay network glitch.
The default is 10 errors.
The lower limit is 0; the default will apply if this is exceeded.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.IOErrorCheckInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval that the will be checked. If the threshold is reached within the interval for a particular node, all keys mapped to that node the SDK will fail with a in the field. The node will be flagged as "dead" and will try to reconnect, if connectivity is reached, the node will continue to process requests.
member.remarks: The purpose of this is to distinguish between a remote host being unreachable or temporay network glitch.
The default is 500ms; use milliseconds to override this: 1000 = 1 second.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.Providers.CouchbaseClientSection.QueryFailedThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the query failed threshold for a before it is flagged as "un-responsive". Once flagged as "un-responsive", no requests will be sent to that node until a server re-config has occurred and the is added back into the pool. This is so the client will not send requests to a server node which is unresponsive.
member.remarks: The default is 2.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.QueryFailedThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the query failed threshold for a before it is flagged as "un-responsive". Once flagged as "un-responsive", no requests will be sent to that node until a server re-config has occurred and the is added back into the pool. This is so the client will not send requests to a server node which is unresponsive.
member.remarks: The default is 2.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.QueryRequestTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for a N1QL query request; this correlates to the client-side timeout. Server-side timeouts are configured per request using the method.
member.remarks: The value must be positive.
The default client-side value is 75 seconds.
The default server-side timeout is zero; this is an infinite timeout.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.SearchRequestTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the search request timeout.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.NodeAvailableCheckInterval
member.summary: If the client detects that a node has gone offline it will check for connectivity at this interval.
member.remarks: The default is 1000ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.EnableTcpKeepAlives
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether enable TCP keep alives.
member.value: true to enable TCP keep alives; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.TcpKeepAliveTime
member.summary: Specifies the timeout, in milliseconds, with no activity until the first keep-alive packet is sent.
member.value: The TCP keep alive time in milliseconds.
member.remarks: The default is 2hrs.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.TcpKeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Specifies the interval, in milliseconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received.
member.value: The TCP keep alive interval in milliseconds..
member.remarks: The default is 1 second.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.IOErrorThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the count of IO errors within a specific interval defined by the value of . If the threshold is reached within the interval for a particular node, all keys mapped to that node the SDK will fail with a in the field.. The node will be flagged as "dead" and will try to reconnect, if connectivity is reached, the node will continue to process requests.
member.remarks: The purpose of this is to distinguish between a remote host being unreachable or temporay network glitch.
The default is 10 errors.
The lower limit is 0; the default will apply if this is exceeded.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.IOErrorCheckInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval that the will be checked. If the threshold is reached within the interval for a particular node, all keys mapped to that node the SDK will fail with a in the field. The node will be flagged as "dead" and will try to reconnect, if connectivity is reached, the node will continue to process requests.
member.remarks: The purpose of this is to distinguish between a remote host being unreachable or temporay network glitch.
The default is 500ms; use milliseconds to override this: 1000 = 1 second.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.UseSsl
member.summary: Set to true to use Secure Socket Layers (SSL) to encrypt traffic between the client and Couchbase server.
member.remarks: Requires the SSL certificate to be stored in the local Certificate Authority to enable SSL.
This feature is only supported by Couchbase Cluster 3.0 and greater.
Set to true to require all buckets to use SSL.
Set to false and then set UseSSL at the individual Bucket level to use SSL on specific buckets.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.SslPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the SSL port to use for Key/Value operations using the Binary Memcached protocol.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for SSL is 11207.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
Requires UseSSL to be true.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom SSL port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.ApiPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Views REST API to use a custom port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for the Views REST API is 8092.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Views REST API port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.MgmtPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Couchbase Management REST API to use a custom port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for the Views REST API is 8091.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Management REST API port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.DirectPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the direct port to use for Key/Value operations using the Binary Memcached protocol.
member.remarks: The default and suggested direct port is 11210.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom direct port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.HttpsMgmtPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Couchbase Management REST API to use a custom SSL port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for SSL is 18091.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
Requires UseSSL to be true.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Couchbase Management REST API SSL port.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Configuration.Client.ClientConfiguration.HttpsApiPort
member.summary: Overrides the default and sets the Couchbase Views REST API to use a custom SSL port.
member.remarks: The default and suggested port for SSL is 18092.
Only set if you wish to override the default behavior.
Requires UseSSL to be true.
The Couchbase Server/Cluster needs to be configured to use a custom Couchbase Views REST API SSL port.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Configuration.ConfigContextBase.InvalidateQueryCache
member.summary: Invalidates and clears the query cache. This method can be used to explicitly clear the internal N1QL query cache. This cache will be filled with non-adhoc query statements (query plans) to speed up those subsequent executions. Triggering this method will wipe out the complete cache, which will not cause an interruption but rather all queries need to be re-prepared internally. This method is likely to be deprecated in the future once the server side query engine distributes its state throughout the cluster.
member.returns: An representing the size of the cache before it was cleared.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.ExpressionVisitors.LambdaSimplifyingExpressionVisitor
member.summary: Simplifies an expression tree by evaluating any branches of the tree that do not include lambda parameter references. This will remove references to variables external to the lambda by converting them to constants, perform arithmetic, and execute method calls as needed. For example, a call to "str.ToUpper()" where string is an external variable would be simplified to a containing the uppercase version of str.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.DocumentMutationLostException
member.summary: The observed document was lost during a hard failover, because the document did not reach the replica in time.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.ReplicaNotConfiguredException

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.IBucket.Increment(System.String)
member.summary: Increments the value of a key by one. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and seeded with 1.

members.member:
Increments the value of a key by one as an asynchronous operation. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created. and seeded with 1.
The object representing the asynchronous operation.///

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.IBucket.Increment(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Increments the value of a key by the delta. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and seeded with the defaut initial value 1.
member.param: The key to us for the counter.
The number to increment the key by.
member.returns: If the key doesn't exist, the server will respond with the initial value. If not the incremented value will be returned.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.IBucket.IncrementAsync(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Increments the value of a key by the delta as an asynchronous operation. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and seeded with the defaut initial value 1.
member.param: The key to us for the counter.
The number to increment the key by.
member.remarks: If the key doesn't exist, the server will respond with the initial value. If not the incremented value will be returned.
member.returns: The object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.IBucket.Increment(System.String,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Increments the value of a key by the delta. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and seeded with the defaut initial value 1.
member.param: The key to us for the counter.
The number to increment the key by.
The initial value to use. If the key doesn't exist, this value will returned.
member.returns: If the key doesn't exist, the server will respond with the initial value. If not the incremented value will be returned.

The initial value to use. If the key doesn't exist, this value will returned.
member.remarks: If the key doesn't exist, the server will respond with the initial value. If not the incremented value will be returned.
member.returns: The object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.IBucket.Increment(System.String,System.UInt64,System.UInt64,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of a key by the delta. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and seeded with the defaut initial value 1.
member.param: The key to us for the counter.
The number to increment the key by.
The initial value to use. If the key doesn't exist, this value will returned.
The time-to-live (ttl) for the counter in seconds.
member.remarks: Expirations over 30 * 24 * 60 * 60 (the amount of seconds in 30 days) are interpreted as a UNIX timestamp of the date at which the document expires. see documentation section about expiration.
member.returns: If the key doesn't exist, the server will respond with the initial value. If not the incremented value will be returned.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.Server._heartBeatTimer_Elapsed(System.Object,System.Timers.ElapsedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the Elapsed event of the _heartBeatTimer control which is enabled whenever a node is unresponsive and possible offline. Once it is started, the node will be flagged as (which will be true). When the node is down, all operations (K/V, view and or query) that are mapped to this node will fail with a - however, since operations are retried, it may be routed to a live node and succeed. The logs will reflect this but the result to the user will be a successful execution of a given operation.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.Server.CheckQueryNode
member.summary: If the node is strictly a query node, this method will send a simple statement to be executed. If it returns successfully, then the node will be marked as not down and put back into rotation.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.Server.CheckDataNode
member.summary: If a data only node is flaged as down, this method will be invoked every . When invoked, it will attempt to get a connection and perform a NOOP on it. If the NOOP succeeds, then the node will be put back into rotation.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.Server.InvalidateQueryCache
member.summary: Invalidates and clears the query cache. This method can be used to explicitly clear the internal N1QL query cache. This cache will be filled with non-adhoc query statements (query plans) to speed up those subsequent executions. Triggering this method will wipe out the complete cache, which will not cause an interruption but rather all queries need to be re-prepared internally. This method is likely to be deprecated in the future once the server side query engine distributes its state throughout the cluster.
member.returns: An representing the size of the cache before it was cleared.

member.name: M:Couchbase.CouchbaseBucket.InvalidateQueryCache
member.summary: Invalidates and clears the query cache. This method can be used to explicitly clear the internal N1QL query cache. This cache will be filled with non-adhoc query statements (query plans) to speed up those subsequent executions. Triggering this method will wipe out the complete cache, which will not cause an interruption but rather all queries need to be re-prepared internally. This method is likely to be deprecated in the future once the server side query engine distributes its state throughout the cluster.
member.returns: An representing the size of the cache before it was cleared.

member.typeparam: The Type parameter of the passed in operation.
member.returns: True if the operation should be retried again with the new config.

member.name: T:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus
member.summary: The response status for binary Memcached and Couchbase operations.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.None
member.summary: Indicates that the enum has not been set.
member.remarks: 0 has already been taken by the Memcached protocol for success.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.Success
member.summary: The operation was successful

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.KeyNotFound
member.summary: The key does not exist in the database

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.KeyExists
member.summary: The key exists in the database.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.ValueTooLarge
member.summary: The value of the object stored was too large.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.InvalidArguments
member.summary: The arguments of the operation were invalid.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.ItemNotStored
member.summary: The item could be stored in the database

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.IncrDecrOnNonNumericValue
member.summary: The increment operation was called on a non-numeric value

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.VBucketBelongsToAnotherServer
member.summary: The VBucket the operation was attempted on, no longer belongs to the server. This is a common during rebalancing after adding or removing a node or during a failover.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.AuthenticationError
member.summary: The connection to Couchbase could not be authenticated.
member.remarks: Check the bucket name and/or password being used.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.AuthenticationContinue
member.summary: During SASL authentication, another step (or more) must be made before authentication is complete. This is a system-level response status.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.InvalidRange
member.summary: The value was outside of supported range.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.UnknownCommand
member.summary: The server received an unknown command from a client.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.OutOfMemory
member.summary: The server is temporarily out of memory.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.NotSupported
member.summary: The operation is not supported.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.InternalError
member.summary: An internal error has occured.
member.remarks: See logs for more details.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.Busy
member.summary: The server was too busy to complete the operation.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.TemporaryFailure
member.summary: A temporary error has occured in the server.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.ClientFailure
member.summary: A client error has occured before the operation could be sent to the server.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.OperationTimeout
member.summary: The operation exceeded the specified OperationTimeout configured for the client instance.
member.remarks: The default is 2500ms.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.NoReplicasFound
member.summary: Returned when the client cannot locate a replica within the cluster map config for a replica read. This would happen if a bucket was not configured to have replicas; if you encounter this error check to make sure you have indeed configured replicas on your bucket.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.NodeUnavailable
member.summary: The node or service that the key has been mapped to is offline or cannot be reached.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.TransportFailure
member.summary: Indicates that a transport layer failure occured while the client was sending or receiving data.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.DocumentMutationLost
member.summary: Document Mutation lost during a hard failover.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathNotFound
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating the path inside the JSON is invalid.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathMismatch
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating one of the path components was denoting a wrong type (eg. trying to access an array index in an entry that isn't an array). Also for arithmetic operations when the value of the path is not a number.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathInvalid
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the path provided is invalid. For operations requiring an array index, this is returned if the last component of that path isn't an array. Similarly for operations requiring a dictionary, if the last component isn't a dictionary but eg. an array index.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathTooBig
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the path is too large (ie. the string is too long) or too deep (more that 32 components).

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocDocTooDeep
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the target document's level of JSON nesting is too deep to be processed by the subdoc service.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocCannotInsert
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the target document is not flagged or recognized as JSON.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocDocNotJson
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, for arithmetic subdoc operations, the existing number is already too large.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocNumRange
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that for arithmetic subdoc operations, the operation will make the value too large.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathExists
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the last component of the path already exist despite the mutation operation expecting it not to exist (the mutation was expecting to create only the last part of the path and store the fragment there).

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocValueTooDeep
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, in a multi-specification, an invalid combination of commands were specified, including the case where too many paths were specified.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocInvalidCombo
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, in a multi-specification, an invalid combination of commands were specified, including the case where too many paths were specified.

member.name: F:Couchbase.IO.ResponseStatus.SubDocMultiPathFailure
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, in a multi-specification, one or more commands failed to execute on a document which exists (ie. the key was valid).

member.name: T:Couchbase.IQueryCacheInvalidator
member.summary: Provides a method signature for invalidating and clearing a cache.

member.name: M:Couchbase.IQueryCacheInvalidator.InvalidateQueryCache
member.summary: Invalidates and clears the query cache. This method can be used to explicitly clear the internal N1QL query cache. This cache will be filled with non-adhoc query statements (query plans) to speed up those subsequent executions. Triggering this method will wipe out the complete cache, which will not cause an interruption but rather all queries need to be re-prepared internally. This method is likely to be deprecated in the future once the server side query engine distributes its state throughout the cluster.
member.returns: An representing the size of the cache before it was cleared.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of replicas of each document: minimum 0, maximum 3.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the authentication to use.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.BucketSettings.FlushEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether flush is enabled for the specified bucket.
member.value: true if flush is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.BucketSettings.ParallelDbAndViewCompaction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether database and view files on disk can be compacted simultaneously.

member.summary: Gets or sets the password for SASL authentication. Required if SASL authentication has been enabled.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.BucketSettings.ThreadNumber

member.summary: Creates a new bucket on the cluster

The RAM quota in megabytes. The default is 100.
Required parameter. Type of bucket to be created. Memcached configures as Memcached bucket. Couchbase configures as Couchbase bucket

Disable or enable indexes for bucket replicas.
Enables the flush functionality on the specified bucket.
Indicates whether database and view files on disk can be compacted simultaneously.

Optional Parameter. Integer from 2 to 8. Change the number of concurrent readers and writers for the data bucket.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating the result.

member.summary: Creates a new bucket on the cluster
member.param: Required parameter. Name for new bucket.
The RAM quota in megabytes. The default is 100.
Required parameter. Type of bucket to be created. Memcached configures as Memcached bucket. Couchbase configures as Couchbase bucket
The number of replicas of each document: minimum 0, maximum 3.
Disable or enable indexes for bucket replicas.
Enables the flush functionality on the specified bucket.
Indicates whether database and view files on disk can be compacted simultaneously.
Optional Parameter. String. Password for SASL authentication. Required if SASL authentication has been enabled.
Optional Parameter. Integer from 2 to 8. Change the number of concurrent readers and writers for the data bucket.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating the result.

member.summary: Represents a request for a N1QL query

member.name: P:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.Lifespan
member.summary: Sets the lifespan of the query request; used to check if the request exceeded the maximum time configured for it in

member.name: P:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.IsPrepared
member.summary: Returns true if the request is not ad-hoc and has been optimized using .

member.name: P:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.IsAdHoc
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this query statement is to executed in an ad-hoc manner.
member.value: true if this instance is ad-hoc; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.HasBeenRetried
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance has been retried (if it's been optimized and prepared then the server marked it as stale/not runnable).
member.value: true if this instance has been retried once, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.MaxServerParallelism(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the maximum parallelism for the query. A zero or negative value means the number of logical cpus will be used as the parallelism for the query. There is also a server wide max_parallelism parameter which defaults to 1. If a request includes max_parallelism, it will be capped by the server max_parallelism. If a request does not include max_parallelism, the server wide max_parallelism will be used.

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.AdHoc(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, the client will try to perform optimizations transparently based on the server capabilities, like preparing the statement and then executing a query plan instead of the raw query.
member.param: if set to false the query will be optimized if possible.
member.remarks: The default is true; the query will executed in an ad-hoc manner, without special optomizations.

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.Statement(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a N1QL statement to be executed.
member.param: Any valid N1QL statement for a POST request, or a read-only N1QL statement (SELECT, EXPLAIN) for a GET request.
member.returns: A reference to the current for method chaining.
member.remarks: If both prepared and statement are present and non-empty, an error is returned.
Required if prepared not provided.

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.Prepared(Couchbase.N1QL.QueryPlan,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a N1QL statement to be executed in an optimized way using the given queryPlan.
member.param: The original statement (eg. SELECT * FROM default) that the user attempted to optimize
member.returns: A reference to the current for method chaining.
member.remarks: Required if statement not provided, will erase a previous call to .

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.IQueryRequest.Timeout(System.TimeSpan)

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.QueryRequest.MaxServerParallelism(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the maximum parallelism for the query. A zero or negative value means the number of logical cpus will be used as the parallelism for the query. There is also a server wide max_parallelism parameter which defaults to 1. If a request includes max_parallelism, it will be capped by the server max_parallelism. If a request does not include max_parallelism, the server wide max_parallelism will be used.

member.param: if set to false the query will be optimized if possible.
member.remarks: The default is true; the query will executed in an ad-hoc manner, without special optomizations.

member.name: T:Couchbase.N1QL.ScanConsistency
member.summary: Sets the desired index scan consistency for current N1QL query.

member.name: F:Couchbase.N1QL.ScanConsistency.NotBounded
member.summary: The default which means that the query can return data that is currently indexed and accessible by the index or the view. The query output can be arbitrarily out-of-date if there are many pending mutations that have not been indexed by the index or the view. This consistency level is useful for queries that favor low latency and do not need precise and most up-to-date information.

member.name: F:Couchbase.N1QL.ScanConsistency.RequestPlus
member.summary: This level provides the strictest consistency level and thus executes with higher latencies than the other levels. This consistency level requires all mutations, up to the moment of the query request, to be processed before the query execution can start.

member.name: F:Couchbase.N1QL.ScanConsistency.StatementPlus
member.summary: Not supported; do not use.

member.name: F:Couchbase.N1QL.ScanConsistency.AtPlus
member.summary: Do not use; for RYOW use and do not specify a .

member.name: M:Couchbase.N1QL.QueryClient.InvalidateQueryCache
member.summary: Invalidates and clears the query cache. This method can be used to explicitly clear the internal N1QL query cache. This cache will be filled with non-adhoc query statements (query plans) to speed up those subsequent executions. Triggering this method will wipe out the complete cache, which will not cause an interruption but rather all queries need to be re-prepared internally. This method is likely to be deprecated in the future once the server side query engine distributes its state throughout the cluster.
member.returns: An representing the size of the cache before it was cleared.
member.exception: The dictionary already contains the maximum number of elements ().

member.summary: A docId query is a query that directly matches the documents whose ID have been provided. It can be combined within a ConjunctionQuery to restrict matches on the set of documents.

member.summary: Adds the specified document ids.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.MatchAllQuery
member.summary: A match all query matches all documents in the index. It can take search parameters as other queries, so this can be restricted (eg. with limit).

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.MatchNoneQuery
member.summary: A match none query doesn't match any document in the index.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.PhraseQuery
member.summary: The phrase query allows to query for exact term phrases in the index. The provided terms must exist in the correct order, at the correct index offsets, in the specified field (as no analyzer are applied to the terms). Queried field must have been indexed with includeTermVectors set to true. It is generally more useful in debugging scenarios, and the Match Phrase Query should usually be preferred for real-world use cases.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.PhraseQuery.Field(System.String)
member.summary: The field to search against.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.TermQuery
member.summary: A term query is a query that may be "fuzzy" and matches terms within a specified edit distance (Levenshtein distance). Also, you can optionally specify that the term must have a matching prefix of the specified length.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.TermQuery.Field(System.String)
member.summary: The field to search against.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.WildcardQuery
member.summary: A wildcard query is a query in which term the character * will match 0..n occurrences of any characters and ? will match 1 occurrence of any character.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.WildcardQuery.Field(System.String)
member.summary: The field for the match.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.MatchPhraseQuery
member.summary: A match query searches for terms occurring in the specified positions and offsets. The input text is analyzed and a phrase query is built with the terms resulting from the analysis. This depends on term vectors, which are consulted to determine phrase distance.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.MatchQuery
member.summary: A query that analyzes the input text and uses that analyzed text to query the index.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.PrefixQuery
member.summary: The prefix query finds documents containing terms that start with the provided prefix.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Utils.SynchronizationContextExclusion
member.summary: Temporarily removes the from the current thread, replacing it once the object is disposed.
member.remarks: This is designed to help prevent deadlocks when synchronously waiting on an asynchronous task, as in http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2012/04/13/10293638.aspx. This class is designed to be used with a "using" clause for simplicity and to guarantee that the context is replaced even if there is an exception.

member.name: P:Couchbase.IResult.Success
member.summary: Returns true if the operation was succesful.
member.remarks: If Success is false, use the Message property to help determine the reason.

member.name: P:Couchbase.IResult.Message
member.summary: If the operation wasn't succesful, a message indicating why it was not succesful.

member.name: P:Couchbase.IResult.Exception
member.summary: If Success is false and an exception has been caught internally, this field will contain the exception.

member.name: M:Couchbase.IResult.ShouldRetry
member.summary: If the response indicates the request is retryable, returns true.
member.remarks: Intended for internal use only.

member.name: T:Couchbase.OperationResult
member.summary: The result of an operation.
member.remarks: If Success is false, use the Message property to help determine the reason.

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Success
member.summary: True if the operation succeeded.
member.remarks: If Success is false, use the Message property to help determine the reason.

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Message
member.summary: If Success is false, the reason why the operation failed.

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Token
member.summary: Gets the mutation token for the operation if enhanced durability is enabled.

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Cas
member.summary: The 'Check and Set' or 'CAS' value for enforcing optimistic concurrency.

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Status
member.summary: The status returned from the Couchbase Server after an operation.
member.remarks: will be returned if is true, otherwise will be false. If is returned, then the operation failed before being sent to the Couchbase Server.

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Durability
member.summary: The level of durability that the operation achieved

member.name: P:Couchbase.OperationResult.Exception
member.summary: If Success is false and an exception has been caught internally, this field will contain the exception.

member.name: M:Couchbase.OperationResult.IsNmv
member.summary: Checks if the server responded with a Not My Vbucket.
member.returns: Returns true if is a VBucketBelongsToAnotherServer.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.name: M:Couchbase.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used

member.name: F:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member

member.name: F:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or

member.name: F:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used

member.name: F:Couchbase.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcSupressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling all inspections for MVC views within a class or a method.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object)

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name

member.name: T:Couchbase.Annotations.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String)

member.name: T:Couchbase.ServerUnavailableException
member.summary: Thrown when the client cannot find a healthy server to execute an operation on. This could temporarily happen during a swap/failover/rebalance situation. The calling code could decide to retry the operation after handling this exception.

member.name: T:Couchbase.ErrorPrepared
member.summary: An enum listing the N1QL codes that should trigger a retry for non adhoc queries.
member.remarks: Generic (5000) also needs a check of the message content to determine if retry is applicable or not
